summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 8, 2020, discussing coordination with the SDNY regarding a press release about Prince Andrew's response to an MLAT request. It also provides an update on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, including planned indictment charges and surveillance activities.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Subject of MLAT request and investigation
persons.context: His counsel is issuing a public statement in response to an MLAT request from SDNY prosecutors; there have been conversations about interviewing him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The FBI plans to obtain a six-count indictment against her when a grand jury is available; a mail cover and pen register are active on her suspected location and phone.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in an email forwarding a news article about Prince Andrew.

persons.name: John
persons.context: Addressed in an email forwarding a news article about Prince Andrew; another email mentions not having heard from him.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same FBI/SDNY investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein, with Prince Andrew being sought for an interview via MLAT and Maxwell facing planned indictment.

events.title: FBI-SDNY coordination on Prince Andrew press release
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss coordinating with SDNY's press office regarding a public statement in response to Prince Andrew's counsel issuing a statement about the MLAT request.

events.title: Update on Ghislaine Maxwell investigation
events.description: FBI email outlines planned six-count indictment against Maxwell for conspiracy to entice, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation, and two counts of perjury. Surveillance activities (mail cover, pen register) are ongoing.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in New York (SDNY) had requested to interview Prince Andrew via an MLAT (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty) request, and his counsel was issuing a public statement in response.
The FBI and SDNY were actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell and planned to seek a six-count federal indictment against her once a grand jury was available.
The planned charges against Maxwell included conspiracy to entice minors, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of minors, and two counts of perjury.
Investigative techniques in use against Maxwell included a mail cover on a suspected address and a renewed pen register on her phone, with plans for physical surveillance.
